_meta.description: Sample data for Bookings & Messaging section

models.Booking: A job engagement between a company (client) and a technician. Can be either a direct booking or an open booking with multiple applications. Includes negotiation through offers/counter-offers, contract management, deposits, time tracking, and invoicing.
models.BookingApplication: An application from a technician to an open booking posted by a client. Includes proposed rate, availability message, and application status.
models.Offer: A booking offer or counter-offer from either party during negotiation. Includes proposed rate, dates, duration, and optional message explaining the terms.
models.Contract: A service agreement between technician and client outlining scope, terms, deliverables, and cancellation policy. Requires signatures from both parties before work begins.
models.Deposit: A payment required from the client to confirm a booking, typically a percentage of the total estimated cost. Deducted from the final invoice.
models.TimeEntry: A time tracking record logged by the technician during service delivery. Includes start/end times, duration, notes, and billable status. Can be approved or disputed by the client.
models.Invoice: A bill generated by the technician for completed work, based on tracked time and agreed rates. Includes line items, deposit deductions, taxes, and payment status.
models.Message: A communication within a booking-specific message thread. Supports text content and file attachments.

relationships.booking_to_company: Each Booking belongs to one Company (client)
relationships.booking_to_technician: Each Booking belongs to one Technician
relationships.booking_to_offers: Each Booking has many Offers (negotiation history)
relationships.booking_to_contract: Each Booking has one Contract (once accepted)
relationships.booking_to_deposit: Each Booking may have one Deposit
relationships.booking_to_invoice: Each Booking may have one or more Invoices
relationships.booking_to_messages: Each Booking has many Messages (conversation thread)

bookings.title: Corporate Annual Gala 2025
bookings.description: Need an experienced audio engineer for our company's annual gala. Event includes keynote speeches, live band performance, and awards ceremony. Venue has a Meyer Sound PA system and Yamaha CL5 console.
bookings.location: Grand Ballroom, Hilton Downtown, San Francisco, CA
bookings.cancellationPolicy: Full refund if cancelled 14+ days before event. 50% refund if cancelled 7-13 days before. No refund within 7 days.

bookings.title: Wedding Reception Lighting
bookings.description: Looking for a creative lighting designer for an elegant wedding reception. Venue is a converted warehouse with high ceilings. Client wants romantic uplighting, dance floor effects, and sophisticated ambient lighting. Must bring own equipment.

bookings.title: Live Music Festival - Main Stage
bookings.description: Seeking lead audio engineer for 2-day outdoor music festival. Responsible for main stage sound during headliner sets. Must have experience with large-format consoles and outdoor festival environments. Equipment provided.
bookings.cancellationPolicy: Full refund if cancelled 30+ days before event. 50% refund if cancelled 15-29 days before. No refund within 15 days.

bookings.title: Theater Production - A Christmas Carol
bookings.description: Looking for experienced lighting designer for our winter theater production. Must create lighting plots, program cues, and operate during all 12 performances. Experience with ETC Ion console required.
bookings.cancellationPolicy: Full refund if cancelled 30+ days before event. 25% refund if cancelled 15-29 days before. No refund within 15 days.

bookings.title: Multi-Camera Conference Recording
bookings.description: Need video engineer to set up and operate 3-camera shoot for our annual shareholders meeting. Must handle live IMAG to screens and produce recorded output. Experience with Ross switchers preferred.
bookings.location: Convention Center Hall B, Seattle, WA
bookings.cancellationPolicy: Full refund if cancelled 14+ days before event. 50% refund if cancelled 7-13 days before. No refund within 7 days.

bookings.title: Arena Concert Rigging
bookings.description: Experienced rigger needed for arena concert setup. Will be hanging truss, motors, and lighting/audio equipment. Must have arena rigging experience and current certifications. This is a 3-day load-in, show, and load-out.
bookings.location: Madison Square Garden, New York, NY
bookings.cancellationPolicy: Full refund if cancelled 30+ days before event. 50% refund if cancelled 15-29 days before. No refund within 15 days.

bookings.title: Corporate Product Launch
bookings.description: Upscale product launch event requiring sophisticated lighting design. Client wants dramatic reveals, dynamic color changes, and professional stage lighting. Venue has installed rig but needs programmer/operator.
bookings.location: Skyline Rooftop Venue, Los Angeles, CA
bookings.cancellationPolicy: Full refund if cancelled 14+ days before event. 50% refund if cancelled 7-13 days before. No refund within 7 days.

bookings.title: Weekly Jazz Club Sound Engineer
bookings.description: Looking for a reliable sound engineer for our weekly jazz nights. Thursday evenings, ongoing engagement. Venue has house PA (JBL system, Allen & Heath SQ-6). Must be comfortable mixing live jazz and working with varied lineups.
bookings.location: Blue Note Jazz Club, Chicago, IL

bookingApplications.coverMessage: I'd love to work on your wedding reception! I have 8 years of experience creating romantic lighting for upscale events. I specialize in elegant uplighting and have a full inventory of wireless LED fixtures perfect for a warehouse venue. My portfolio includes 50+ weddings. I can provide references from recent clients.
bookingApplications.availability: Fully available for this date, including setup time starting at 2pm if needed.

bookingApplications.coverMessage: Hi! I'm a lighting designer based in Brooklyn and would love to help with your wedding. I have experience with warehouse venues and can create beautiful, romantic atmospheres. I bring my own equipment including 20 uplights and dance floor effects.

I'm very interested in this ongoing position. I've been mixing live jazz for 12 years and know how to handle the dynamics and spontaneity of jazz performances. I'm familiar with the Allen & Heath SQ series and have worked at several Chicago venues. I'm looking for a regular Thursday gig and can commit long-term.
bookingApplications.availability: Available every Thursday evening for the foreseeable future.

bookingApplications.coverMessage: Hello! I'm a Chicago-based audio engineer with strong jazz mixing experience. I understand the nuances of mixing upright bass, drums, and horn sections. I've worked at Green Mill and Andy's Jazz Club. Very reliable and professional.

offers.message: Hi Marcus, we'd love to have you engineer our annual gala. The rate is $80/hour for an estimated 5 hours. Let me know if this works for you!
Thanks for thinking of me! I'd be happy to work your gala. Given the venue size and complexity, I'd like to propose $85/hour. This includes pre-event consultation and any technical planning needed.
Alex, we need an experienced festival audio engineer for our main stage. 2 full days, $95/hour. Are you available?
Taylor, we need an experienced arena rigger for a 3-day concert setup. $100/hour for approximately 65 hours. Interested?

Hi Jamie, I'm definitely interested! For arena rigging work at MSG, the industry rate for my experience level is $110/hour. I have all current certifications and 10 years of arena experience. Let me know if this works.

contracts.title: Audio Engineering Services Agreement
contracts.scope:
Provide professional audio engineering services for Corporate Annual Gala 2025 including:
- Pre-event technical consultation and planning
- Sound system setup and testing (4 hours prior to event)
- Live mixing during event (5 hours)
- Strike and equipment return
- Keynote speech reinforcement
- Live band mixing and monitor management
- Awards ceremony audio support
contracts.terms: Services will be provided on February 15, 2025 from 6:00 PM to 11:00 PM at the Grand Ballroom, Hilton Downtown, San Francisco. Client agrees to pay $85 per hour for 5 hours of service ($425 total). Payment due within 14 days of invoice. Late payments subject to 1.5% monthly interest.
contracts.deliverables:
- Professional audio mixing throughout event
- Clear, balanced sound for all program elements
- Responsive adjustments to client needs during event
- Post-event equipment strike
contracts.cancellationPolicy: Full refund if cancelled 14+ days before event. 50% refund if cancelled 7-13 days before. No refund within 7 days.

contracts.title: Festival Audio Engineering Services Agreement
contracts.scope:
Provide lead audio engineering services for Live Music Festival main stage including:
- Pre-festival technical meetings and planning
- Sound system tuning and optimization
- Live mixing for all headliner performances
- Monitor system management
- Collaboration with stage crew and production team
- Troubleshooting and technical support throughout festival
contracts.terms: Services will be provided April 12-13, 2025 at Riverside Park Amphitheater, Austin, TX. Estimated 34 hours at $95/hour ($3,230 total). Actual hours based on time tracking. Payment due within 30 days of invoice. Accommodations and meals provided by festival.
contracts.deliverables:
- Professional audio mixing for all main stage performances
- System optimization for outdoor environment
- Responsive technical support throughout festival
- Post-festival equipment checks and documentation
contracts.cancellationPolicy: Full refund if cancelled 30+ days before event. 50% refund if cancelled 15-29 days before. No refund within 15 days.

contracts.title: Theater Lighting Design Services Agreement
contracts.scope:
Provide complete lighting design and operation services for theater production of 'A Christmas Carol' including:
- Initial lighting design and plot creation
- Programming of all lighting cues on ETC Ion console
- Technical rehearsals and cue refinement
- Operation during all 12 performances
- Maintenance and troubleshooting throughout run
contracts.terms: Services provided December 10-22, 2024 at Riverside Community Theater, Portland. Total 96 hours at $75/hour ($7,200 total). Includes design, programming, tech rehearsals, and 12 performances. Payment due within 30 days of final performance.
contracts.deliverables:
- Complete lighting plot and paperwork
- Fully programmed lighting cues
- Professional operation of all performances
- Designer notes and documentation for theater archive
contracts.cancellationPolicy: Full refund if cancelled 30+ days before event. 25% refund if cancelled 15-29 days before. No refund within 15 days.

contracts.title: Video Engineering Services Agreement
contracts.scope:
Provide video engineering services for shareholders meeting including:
- 3-camera setup and configuration
- Live IMAG switching to venue screens
- Recorded program output
- Graphics playback integration
- Technical support throughout event
contracts.terms: Services provided February 28, 2025 from 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM at Convention Center Hall B, Seattle. 9 hours at $90/hour ($810 total). Payment due within 14 days of invoice.
contracts.deliverables:
- Professional multi-camera video production
- Clean IMAG feed to venue screens
- High-quality recorded output delivered within 48 hours
- Technical documentation
contracts.cancellationPolicy: Full refund if cancelled 14+ days before event. 50% refund if cancelled 7-13 days before. No refund within 7 days.

deposits.refundPolicy: Full refund if booking cancelled per cancellation policy
Full refund if booking cancelled per cancellation policy
Non-refundable as work has been completed
Full refund if booking cancelled per cancellation policy
50% refunded per cancellation policy (cancelled 13 days before event)

timeEntries.notes: Day 1: System tuning and soundcheck for main stage. Worked with stage crew to optimize speaker positioning. Ran through line checks with all backline equipment.
Day 1 evening performances: Mixed opening acts and headliner. Everything went smoothly, great crowd response.
Tech rehearsal: Programmed all lighting cues for Act 1. Worked with director to refine looks for key scenes.
Tech rehearsal: Programmed lighting cues for Act 2. Made revisions to Act 1 based on director notes.
Opening night performance. All cues executed smoothly. Made minor timing adjustments during show.
Performance 2. Show ran smoothly with no technical issues.
Matinee performance. Adjusted some cue timings for younger audience energy.

invoices.notes: Thank you for a wonderful production! It was a pleasure working with your theater.

lineItems.notes: System tuning, soundcheck, and evening performances

invoices.notes: Partial invoice for Day 1. Final invoice will be sent after festival completion.

messages.content: Hi Marcus! Thanks for accepting the booking. Just wanted to confirm a few details. The venue has a Yamaha CL5 and Meyer Sound PA. Will you need anything else from us?

Perfect! The CL5 and Meyer system are great. I'm all set with that setup. Just need the final program schedule when you have it so I can plan the mix approach. Also, will the band need monitors or are they bringing IEMs?
Good question! The band will need monitors - they're a 5-piece with drums, bass, guitar, keys, and vocals. I'm attaching the program schedule and the band's stage plot.
Thanks! Looks great. I'll plan for 5 monitor mixes. See you on the 15th!
Hey Alex, just giving you a heads up that we're running about 30 minutes behind schedule today. Soundcheck will start at 8:30am instead of 8:00am. Thanks for your patience!
No problem! I'll adjust my schedule. See you at 8:30.
Day 1 is wrapped! Everything sounded great. The headliner was really happy with the mix. Just submitted my time logs for today - 14 hours total. See you tomorrow!
Excellent work today! Just approved your time entries. Looking forward to Day 2!
Show closed last night - what a fantastic run! I've generated the final invoice and it's ready for your review. Total hours came in exactly as estimated. Thanks for trusting me with your production!

Priya, you were amazing! The lighting really elevated the production. Audiences commented on it every night. Invoice looks perfect - processing payment today. We'd love to work with you again next season!

Hi Jamie, I'd love to work this show but I need to counter at $110/hour for arena rigging. This is the standard rate for my experience level and the complexity of MSG rigging. Let me know if that works!
Contract signed! I've confirmed all equipment for the 3-camera shoot. Do you have a contact for the AV coordinator at the convention center? I'd like to coordinate power and video routing in advance.
Great! The AV coordinator is Mike Johnson - his email is mjohnson@conventioncenter.com. I'll CC you on an intro email. Thanks for being so proactive!

Hi Priya, unfortunately we need to postpone this event to Q3. I'm so sorry for the late notice. I've initiated the cancellation - you should receive 50% of the deposit per the cancellation policy. Hope we can work together when we reschedule!
No worries David, I understand these things happen. Thanks for the professional handling. Definitely reach out when you reschedule - I'd love to work on the event!
